question.text: An organism is in the same class but not in the same family. It may belong to same:

options.text: More than one option is correct

solution.text:
Taxonomy is the branch of biological science which includes nomenclature and classification of the organisms into groups based on their shared features and characteristics.

Classification is the process of grouping organisms based on observable features in to categories called 'taxa'. This process involves hierarchy of steps where each taxa represents a rank. All the steps/taxon collectively is referred as taxonomic hierarchy.

Species is the basic unit of classification and consist of similar individuals that can interbreed and produce fertile offspring.

Group of related species which has more characters in common in comparison to species of other genera is referred to as genus.

Order is a rank in classification that is higher than family but lower than class.
